comment: Welp they killed it. This was my favorite app, worth every penny. Now since the last update it takes forever to open, is slow to load, and they got rid of the thunderforest maps. I had it downloaded for my area and relied on that everyday for my work, then all of the sudden I go to pull up the app and it's gone. If something isn't broke, don't try to fix it.

author: Joe T
comment: Awesome app and support. Have been using it for hunting after my GPS broke about 3 years ago! Highly recommend!!

author: Ren Holmes
comment: Great app.

author: Carlos A.
comment: I totally love this app. I am a hunter and use it often while in the woods to find my way out whenever I am not paying attention and don't recall my exact tracks, or simply when I am hiking. There is one feature that at least in my opinion would make this app COMPLETE, and earn 5 stars status from me; I wish I could track my other friends/hunters in our group as we move around while hunting/hiking, of course we all have this app in our phones. That would be the pinnacle of this great app. That to me/us is very important, and my friends and I all agree that with that feature we could move more freely around knowing the we all know where the others are at. Come on BCN, you can do this!!!!  :) Update: 2/13/18: So BCN, when will you come out with your own gps device and teach GARMIN how's done????

reply.author: CritterMap Software LLC
reply.content: If your hunting buddies do not have coverage where they want to track each other, there is no way it can be done with current smartphones. If you do, it is possible.

author: tyler rohren
comment: I really like this app but it sometimes crashes when recording a track, so I need to keep an eye on it. Other than that though, it's awesome.

author: A Google User
comment: Spent 4 days in the Canadian Rockies and before I left, I downloaded various maps at various zoom levels. We even managed to find a couple Geocaching spots to within a couple feet! Canadian Topo maps are detailed & very accurate. Other maps are handy and accurate too.

author: Adam Rios
comment: Does it work with Android Auto? I couldn't even select it as a map source.

author: Lyle Tanner
comment: By far my favorite app for offline navigation. Absolutely LOVE the integration with APRSdroid. Outstanding!

author: Adrien Lerois
comment: Top application

author: Jerry Lance
comment: Great

author: Terry Richardson
comment: Application somehow deleted all of my recorded tracks and waypoints. No response from developer. I will be finding a different option

reply.author: CritterMap Software LLC
reply.content: The apps does not delete tracks and waypoints. I found no record of a message from Terry Richardson, but you can reach the helpdesk by replying.

author: justmetlb
comment: Absolutely marvelous. Been using for 3 years hiking in the mountains. Developer is very responsive to problems, and active in further features. Choose your map style(s), download your area of choice, and away you go - very simple or go complex and detailed. It has got everything. My favorite is exporting my trail into Google Earth. If you were to get stuck on some detail just ask, or there is an extensive online manual. And, that is just the beginning.

author: Josh Chaffee
comment: I really enjoyed the my topo maps app and then found out that it is for large screen devices. I'm hoping this will preform better...

author: Chris Huff
comment: I lived the app till today. I turned it on and now everything is gone and I cant find any of my routes from trips taken or my gpx files of other routes I want to take. Any sugestions?

reply.author: CritterMap Software LLC
reply.content: Go to Storage in settings. You might have to rechoose it if the system has renamed the storage card or something.

author: Andy Wade
comment: Great for recording tracks mushroom hunting and finding my way home or back to choice locations.

author: rouke bakker
comment: I have use the demo version for quite a few years for bike rides and tramping in New Zealand and have been very impressed with it so I decided it was time to get the pro version.

author: David gary
comment: It  does real good tracking your ride with and without service

author: Daniel Engstrom
comment: This app is superb!

author: Matthew Goebel
comment: Great application if you enjoy the outdoors. Can purchase overlays for public/private land borders which was alot of help during my hunting season. Tracks altitude and location really well. And the maps are highly detailed.  The only con/negative I have is the maps are slow to download depending on how big of a map you need to download. Outside of this I have nothing bad to say about this application.

author: Kyle Kirkland
comment: I've tried a few GPS apps but always find myself coming back to this one. I like being able to easily import and export gpx files for trips. I now use it exclusively as my hiking and backpacking database making it much easier to do repeat trips in certain areas.

author: Bryan Gilbert
comment: Great App!  Is there a way to display the waypoint labels text at half size and quarter size like the waypoint icon?

author: James Jantzen
comment: I love this app. I use it while elk hunting. You can download maps before going out and put your phone on airplane mode while hunting. Your battery will last forever, almost.

author: BM Steve
comment: I use this app when dirt biking or mountain biking, download very detailed hi res OpenCycle maps at zoom level 16 for maximum detail in Australia, once you have downloaded some map tiles use a file manager and go to "internal memory/bcnav/archives" and copy the db to your sd card, you can save as many maps as you like this way and never have to download them again, I have an older sony xperia with a 6 inch screen but limited internal memory, it's just the best for navigation, create tracks in google maps and save as kml or gpx files, you won't regret buying this app...

author: John L
comment: This program is awesome.  I used to use a Garmin 62S for backcountry navigation.  I transitioned for a bit using both the Garmin and this app.  My biggest concern is the reliability of my hardware (MotoX) and the battery life.  (The Garmin has survived drops in streams and easily can swap the AA batteries.)  However, the interface of the BCNavigator together with the improved screen on my phone are so much better than the Garmin.  I depend on it for bushwacking in the mountains and desert.  The cost incredibly small for the value.  This is the best app that I have paid for.

author: A Google User
comment: I have used this hunting in Tn. TWRA has KML files which you can import I have used this hunting in Tn. TWRA has KML files which you can import as boundaries.  I also downloaded Thai maps and used it out in the country. Worked great on evo and Note 2 plus Galaxy Tab without cell signal. Thanks.

author: Dominic Beacco
comment: Overly complicated.  A dedicated GPS is much more user-friendly and useful.  Very glitchy on Droid turbo

author: Alan Mackey
comment: This app turns your phone into a full-featured GPS for a few bucks. Plus, it comes with access to Caltopo maps and tons more. Fantastic!

author: Stephen Hall
comment: Great back country GPS  app with excellent access to maps.  Easy to use.  Great tool for hunters, backpackers, or anyone heading into the wilderness.

author: Tony M
comment: Awesome. Highly recommend. Take some time and learn the functions. Offline maps ability is ideal.

author: Steve Walberg
comment: I thought  this app would be great so I bought it, I  think the free version  works better .  I would eat her like it to work or my money  back .

reply.author: CritterMap Software LLC
reply.content: Steve. This app works even better than the free version. We have received and responded to your inquiry. Please take action so you can again see a map at a known place.

author: Derik Espag
comment: Very nice app. But there are 2 short commings.  1 I cant use Google maps as amaps option 2 I cant use the app to do turn-by-turn navigation, a future i need.

author: i2ichardi3
comment: Useful for going off of the beaten path. Ski touring / enduro riding / climbing etc.

author: Luen Warneke
comment: I use the app bushwalking and exploring North Queensland. It's works very well.

author: Brad Howard
comment: Love Love Love it!

author: A Google User
comment: I just can't say it enough; I love this app! Every update brings terrific new functionality to an already great bit of software. I use it often with great success. It is worth far more than the small cost to purchase.  Marvelous app!      Edit: After some time using this app extensively it's still the best. It just gets better and better!  Edit x 2: I just bought this app again for my new phone, simply because the dev deserves it! Terrific app.

author: Steve W
comment: If you do any type of "off the beaten path" exploration, this app will do you well.  I've only used it in Arizona, but it's helped me navigate thousands of miles off road.

author: Stuart Taylor
comment: Replaces a 200 or 300$ GPS (just make sure you have spare phone battery for long trips). Amazing map sources, also being able to import custom maps is great! Interface is very nice, so many options for all kinds of uses, very customizable! My phone will last 3 - 4 days using the app for several hours each day (on airplane mode). Just be sure to turn the GPS off when your not using it. Organizing trips and GPX data is easy! Very helpful tech support also!

author: Hal Ray
comment: I have used this for a few years now. Great hunting/hiking nav app. I live in western Montana and cell service is not available in most of the mountains. The ability to use the maps offline is a must. Take the time to study and learn the app and you will be impressed.

author: Rick Lewis
comment: Excellent application. There is a learning curve but clear and comprehensive documentation is available online and for download. There are also third party YouTube videos which are helpful. This is "back country GPS" not turn by turn GPS to get you to the nearest doughnut shop. Many maps are available for free download and for in-app purchase. If you are a hiker, a back country camper/explorer, a hunter, a fisherman, etc., then check this application out.

author: Andrew Lewis
comment: Used this during a mountain rescue operation to locate a hiking group last weekend. Works brilliantly with open andro maps.
